speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: Yeah, this is Roky. I checked all the connections. I don't know why all the power's down out here. I'm going to have to come in and get some more equipment. Yeah, yeah... yeah, I'll need several of those. All right...

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Um... I don't want to scare you, but... I think I'm madly in love with you. I mean, you're all I think about. You're my whole world.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Harold, I like you a lot too, but this is our first date. I mean, I think that we need more time to get to know one another. What happened?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Oh my God... oh my God...

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Harold, what are those things?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: How the hell should I know?

speaker: ALIEN
line: Jack... what is that thing?

speaker: ABDUCTED SMOKING ALIEN
line: How the hell should I know?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: I had never thought much about it before. I guess that's because I always felt like such an alien myself. That to be concerned with aliens from... other planets, that just seemed so, uh... redundant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'd never actually much considered it myself before I started this job.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Yes. Now, if I understand it correctly, your partner is the, uh, actual expert?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, and I feel that I must apologize for his refusal to speak with you, Mister Chung, but, uh, I must admit, I probably wouldn't have myself if I wasn't such an admirer of your work.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Oh!

speaker: SCULLY
line: "The Lonely Buddha" is one of my favorite novels.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: And hear I was thinking you were just some... brainy beauty. Now I find out that you also have good taste.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What made you decide to write a book about an alien abduction if you're not that interested in the subject yourself?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Actually? It was my publisher's idea. At first I was reluctant, until I realized that I had an opportunity here to create an entirely new literary genre... a non-fiction science fiction. Now, see, that gimmick alone will guarantee it's landing on the best-seller list. In short, to answer your question? Money.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... just as long as you're attempting to record the truth.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Oh, God, no. How can I possibly do that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: I spent three months in Klass County and everybody there has a different version of what truly happened. Truth is as subjective as reality. That will help explain why when people talk about their "UFO experiences," they always start off with "well, now, I know how crazy this is going to sound... but."

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're here to get my version of the truth?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Exactly. Now, when did you first find out about the case?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... not right away, of course. Um... not enough time had elapsed for it to be considered a missing person's case before the girl was found the following morning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was suffering from what my partner calls "missing time." She recalled nothing of the previous night, nor how she had arrived at her present whereabouts. Her body exhibited signs of physical abuse, and all of her clothes were on backwards or inside-out.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Have I had my share of mornings like that. Oh, but these have the characteristics of someone who has... Uh, do you prefer the term "abductee" or "experiencer?"

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually, I prefer neither, but my partner uses "abductee."

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: My preference is for the other. "I've just had a, uh... little alien experience." As opposed to, "I've just been abducted!"

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, regardless, the girl was considered neither at the time. She appeared more to be the victim of date rape than anything else. She was given a physical exam and her statement was taken. Later that night, she received her... visitation.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Oh, Chrissy, thank God you're all right.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: How dare you come here.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Chrissy, I did everything I could.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Don't I know it, you bastard.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Chrissy! Don't you remember?

speaker: FATHER
line: What the hell is going on up there?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Chrissy! I love you!

speaker: SCULLY
line: The father informed the police, who apprehended the boy back at his own home.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: We... we were abducted by aliens.

speaker: MANNERS
line: You don't sound so sure of it.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: It all seems so crazy, and I don't know why Chrissy doesn't remember it.

speaker: MANNERS
line: You're willing to take a lie detector test to prove you were abducted by creatures from outer space?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Yes, I am.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Well, too bad! 'Cause I don't need no lie detector to tell me the only thing you were abducted by were your rampaging hormones, you punk!

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: But he did take a test and passed it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And he stuck to his story... until we got there.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: If she says I raped her, then... I guess I raped her.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't sound so sure of that.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: It all seems so crazy, and I don't know why Chrissy remembers it that way.

speaker: MULDER
line: Would you be willing to take a lie detector test to prove that you raped her?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: No, I'm not.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that's too bad. Because the next rape you experience will probably be your own... in prison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That should have ended our investigation, but Mulder brought the girl in for questioning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you having trouble sleeping? Are you experiencing muscle pains? Vision problems? Nose bleeds? When you look at a particular object, do you receive the sudden flash that you're actually looking at something else? An alien's face?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Yes!

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, my partner became convinced that she was suffering from what he calls "post-abduction syndrome."

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: You don't believe in the disorder?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I think that stress of any kind can cause all of those physical ailments. In any case, Mulder convinced the girl and her parents to let her be hypnotized.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: What is your opinion of hypnosis?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that it has its therapeutic value, but it has never been proven to enhance memory. In fact, it actually worsens it since, since, since people in that state or prone to confabulation.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: When I was doing research for my book "The Caligarian Candidate..."

speaker: SCULLY
line: One of the greatest thrillers ever written.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Oh... Thank you. I was, uh... interested in how the C.I.A., when conducting their MK-Ultra mind control experiments back in the '50s, had no idea how hypnosis went.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmm.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Or what it was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one still knows.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Still, as a storyteller, I'm fascinated how a person's sense of consciousness can be... so transformed by nothing more magical than listening to words. Mere words.

speaker: FINGERS
line: You are feeling very sleepy, very relaxed. As your body calmly drifts deeper and deeper into a state of peaceful relaxation, you will respond only to the sound of my voice. Chrissy? Can you recall where you are?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: I'm in a room... on a spaceship... surrounded by aliens.

speaker: FINGERS
line: What do the aliens look like?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: They're small... but their heads and their eyes are big. They're gray.

speaker: FINGERS
line: Are you alone?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: No, Harold's on another table... but he seems really out of it... like he's not really there.

speaker: FINGERS
line: What are the aliens doing now?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: They're sort of arguing. I sort of hear them but I can't understand what they're saying. Except the leader. I can understand him.

speaker: FINGERS
line: When the leader speaks to you, does his mouth move?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: No. But I hear him in my head.

speaker: FINGERS
line: What is he saying?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: He's telling me this is for the good of my planet, but...

speaker: FINGERS
line: But what?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: I don't like what he's doing. It's like he's inside my mind, like... like he's stealing my memories.

speaker: MULDER
line: The description of the aliens, the physical exam, the mindscan, the presence of another human being that appears switched off, it's all characteristic of a typical abduction.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's my problem with it, Mulder. It's all a little too typical. Abduction lore has become so prevalent in our society that you can ask someone to imagine what it would be like to be abducted and they'd concoct an identical scenario.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, if it were only one person, Scully, but we have two individuals here, each verifying the other's story.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Well, thanks a lot! You really bleeped up this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, of course, he didn't actually say "bleeped." He said...

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: I'm, uh, familiar with, uh, Detective Manners' colorful phraseology.

speaker: MULDER
line: You still going to hold the boy?

speaker: MANNERS
line: Oh, you bet your blankety-blank bleep I am.

speaker: MULDER
line: But the victim seems to confirm his alibi.

speaker: MANNERS
line: The hell she did! Those kids' stories couldn't be more bleeping different.

speaker: HAROLD
line: Chrissy! Chrissy! What do you want with us? What do you want with us?!

speaker: MULDER
line: How did the alien respond?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Well... all he did was...

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: What, what's happening?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Don't worry, it'll okay. I'm here to protect you. I'll never let anything happen to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What was the other alien, the gray, what was it doing during all this.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: He was just... talking.

speaker: MULDER
line: Telepathically?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: No. In english. He just kept saying the same thing over and over again.

speaker: ABDUCTED SMOKING ALIEN
line: This is not happening. This is not happening. This is not happening. This is not happening...

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: Would you shut up already? No! No!

speaker: ABDUCTED SMOKING ALIEN
line: This is not happening. This is not happening.

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: I don't know where I was taken, because the whole time I was like this, in pain.

speaker: MULDER
line: Because the other alien was conducting torturous experiments on you?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: No... no, it was like... you know, you know when you were a kid and you tore the legs off a bug for no reason? I guess I was the bug. Anyways, the next thing I remember, I was suddenly outside... like I was flying through the air or something.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: And then I think I hit the ground. When I came to, I, I immediately ran to Chrissy's to make sure she was there and that she was okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Harold... did you and Chrissy engage in consensual sexual intercourse that night?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: If her father finds out, I'm a dead man.

speaker: MULDER
line: He said it happened before the abduction. So what if they had sex?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So we know that it wasn't an alien who probed her. Mulder, you've got two kids having sex before they're mature enough to know how to handle it.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you're saying that all this is just a case of sexual trauma?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a lot more plausible than an alien abduction, especially in light of their contradictory stories.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Hey! I just got a call from some crazy bleep-head saying he was an eyewitness to this alien abduction. Do you feel like talking to this blank-hole?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: I know how crazy all this sounds, but I don't care. What I have to say has to be said.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why did you wait till now to tell us this information? Two kids' lives may be affected by it.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: Well, it, it's bigger than a couple of kids. It has to do with the entire planet... the universe and who knows what else!

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you tell us what happened that night?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: This. It's all here. After seeing what I saw that night, I rushed right home and wrote it all down. Forty-eight hours straight. I didn't want to forget a single detail. But I feel that I should warn you, I don't want to be overly dramatic here, but by looking at this, you're putting your lives in danger.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why is that?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: Because last night, the weirdest thing happened.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: No other object as been misidentified as a flying saucer more often than the planet Venus.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: Really? That was when I realized something was weird.

speaker: SCULLY
line: At which point?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: See, normally, if two strangers drive into my garage, I tell them to get the hell off the property. But this time, I didn't! It was like I was in a trance or something.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did these men look like?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: Usually, I'm really good with faces, but this time, all I can remember is how they were dressed. They were...

speaker: MULDER
line: All in black?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: How'd you know that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Since the '50s, people who have had close encounters have reported subsequent visits by these unearthly men in black.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: But you know, myths about men in black garments......have been recorded throughout history in many different cultures. The Celtic legends are filled with trickster men in black and how anyone who encounters them becomes enchanted.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unfortunately, I'm not sure that modern reconstruction of ancient fairy tales lends any more credence to Roky's testimony.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: Even the former leader of your United States of America, James Earl Carter Jr., thought he saw a UFO once... But it's been proven he only saw the planet Venus.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: I'm a republican.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: Venus was at its peak brilliance last night. You probably thought you saw something up in the sky other than Venus, but I assure you, it was Venus.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: I know... What I saw.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: Your scientists have yet to discover how neural networks create self-consciousness, let alone how the human brain processes two-dimensional retinal images into the three-dimensional phenomenon known as perception. Yet you somehow brazenly declare seeing is believing? Mister Crikenson, your scientific illiteracy makes me shudder, and I wouldn't flaunt your ignorance by telling anyone that you saw anything last night other than the planet Venus, because if you do, you're a dead man.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: You... can't threaten me.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: I just did.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: This is what they wanted me not to show anyone. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go pack.

speaker: MULDER
line: If we have any more questions, where can we find you?

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: You won't find me.

speaker: MULDER
line: " I sat in my stalled truck, frozen in terror, watching as this third alien attacked the other two gray aliens. And then it happened, the thing that forever changed my life...

speaker: LORD KINBOTE
line: Roky! Roky! Be thou not afraid! No harm will come unto thee.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: Wh, what do you want from me?

speaker: LORD KINBOTE
line: Your efforts are needed for the survival of all earthlings.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: How can I do that?

speaker: LORD KINBOTE
line: Come. I shall showeth...

speaker: MULDER
line: "...thee. Before I knew it, I was aboard the hover vessel and was not heading into outer space, but inner space, heading towards the earth's molten core. For that is the domain of the third alien, whose name, he soon told me... was Lord Kinbote."

speaker: SCULLY
line: In short, Roky showed signs of being what is known as a fantasy-prone personality.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Agent Scully, you are so kindhearted. He's a nut! I just read his manifesto!

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you get a copy?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: One was sent to my publishers. I don't know what was more disturbing... his description of the inner core reincarnated souls sex orgy... or the fact that the whole thing is written in screenplay format.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It definitely was peculiar.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Well, surely, your partner didn't believe any of it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wh, wh, well, Mulder's had his share of peculiar notions. He's not inclined to dismiss anything outright. Mulder, you're nuts!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not saying he isn't delusional, I'm just suggesting that his delusional state was triggered by something he actually witnessed that night. And the first part of his story verifies the boy's version. In fact, the only version that doesn't add up is the girl's.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you calling?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to arrange to have her re-hypnotized.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Re-hypnotized? What for?

speaker: MULDER
line: To see if what she remembers is really what she remembers.

speaker: FINGERS
line: You are feeling very sleepy, very relaxed. As your body calmly drifts deeper and deeper into a state of peaceful relaxation, you will respond only to the sound of my voice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So the girl was put under again to see if she could confirm any of the boy's story. And as I suspected she might under such conditions, she did.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: The whole time it's beating me, I'm like this. And then I, I'm flying through the air.

speaker: FINGERS
line: Now what's happening?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Some men are lifting me off the ground... men in Air Force uniforms.

speaker: MULDER
line: Air Force?

speaker: FINGERS
line: Where are you now, Chrissy?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: I'm in a room. In an office. I'm surrounded by men. Some are in uniforms, some are in suits.

speaker: FINGERS
line: What is he saying?

speaker: HAND
line: You're feeling very sleepy, very relaxed.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: I don't remember.

speaker: FINGERS
line: What are the other men doing?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: They seem to be arguing.

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN #1
line: Ask her if this third alien had a Russian accent.

speaker: CIA MAN #1
line: This is way beyond their capabilities. This is way beyond our capabilities.

speaker: CIA MAN #2
line: Ask if she knows where the gray alien's saucer went to.

speaker: CIA MAN #1
line: How is she going to know that?

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN #1
line: Have we located any of the others?

speaker: CIA MAN #2
line: We're combing the area but this weather makes it tough.

speaker: CIA MAN #1
line: All right. Rinse her out and give her the usual abduction rigmarole.

speaker: FINGERS
line: What is the doctor doing now?

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: He's telling me this is for the good of my country. I don't like what he's doing. He's stealing my memories.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I think you and the hypnotherapist were leading her and I think there was more confabulation in the second version than in the first.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think you're wrong about that, Scully. But I do think you're right about one thing, that this case might not have anything to do with aliens.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Hey, I just got a call from some crazy blankety-blank claiming he found a real live dead alien body.

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: I know how crazy this is going to sound, but... I want to be abducted by aliens.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Why? Whatever for?

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: I hate this town. I hate... people. I just want to be taken away to someplace where I... I don't have to worry about finding a job.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: So you were out in the field that night?

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: Looking for UFOs. There had been some recent sightings so I was just hoping to stumble across one. Now, I've read every book ever written about UFOs and aliens, not because I had to, but because I wanted to. I should've known to just go get my video camera then instead of notifying the proper authorities.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: What was wrong with doing that?

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: Because the proper authorities showed up with a couple of men in black. One of them was disguised as a woman, but wasn't pulling it off. Like, her hair was red but it was a little too red, you know? And the other one... the tall, lanky one... his face was so blank and expressionless. He didn't even seem human. I, I think he was a mandroid. The only time he reacted was when he saw the dead body.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Yeah, that's a bleeping dead alien body if I ever bleeping saw one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wrap it up.

speaker: OFFICER
line: You got him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You never saw this. This didn't happen. You tell anyone, you're a dead man. He said I said what?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: When I interviewed him, he claimed you threatened him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's ridiculous! I'm... and besides, we allowed him to view the autopsy.

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: Whoa!

speaker: MANNERS
line: Hey, hey!

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: You can't suppress the truth! The people have a right to know! Roswell... Roswell!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey! Does that video camera work?

speaker: YAPPI
line: Is this actual footage of an alien autopsy? Or simply a well-made hoax?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: So this is footage of the actual autopsy you performed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is so embarrassing. A picture of Yappi is in the lower corner. Chung presses play.)

speaker: YAPPI
line: Who is that mysterious man who seems to be overseeing the proceedings? And what secret government agency does this autopsy doctor work for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: But see? Whoever got ahold of this footage edited it in such a way as to delete all the significant findings. There appear to be two layers of epidermis. There's a metal strip that runs just under the top layer down the... It's a zipper.

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: You mean it, it's... it's just a dead human being? Well...

speaker: MANNERS
line: Well, then who is this bleep?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but I bet we can find his I.D. from the, uh, military database. Have you seen our video cameraman?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, but I found our alien's I.D. You were right, Mulder. Air Force Major Robert Vallee.

speaker: MULDER
line: That was fast.

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN
line: Agent Mulder? We were notified one of our officers was confined here under your custody.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who notified you?

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN
line: Major Vallee is AWOL, sir. Our orders are to escort him back to the base.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, the major is dead. His body is being detained for further investigation.

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN
line: Investigation into what, ma'am?

speaker: MULDER
line: Possible kidnapping.

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN
line: May we at least view the body for verification?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't see why no...

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, no, but you can talk to the other AWOL pilot that was brought in with him.

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN
line: Lieutenant Jack Schaffer is also in your custody?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's right. Yeah, he's, he's, he's right down... Here. Oh. He, he was, he was here just a few minutes ago. I, I... I guess he's still AWOL. You want to take a look at Vallee?

speaker: AIR FORCE MAN
line: Hmmm. Guess he's still AWOL.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what else is new?

speaker: MULDER
line: I got to find that video guy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The wound is situated to the left of the midline abdomen. The edges of the tissue appear...

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: Who is it? Hey! You just can't... what do you think you're doing? Hey, I... Hey! You have no right to suppress th... Roswell! Roswell! Ros... I was unconscious for... I don't know how long. And the only reason I came to was...

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's the tape?

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: They took it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: The other men in black.

speaker: MULDER
line: If I find out you lied to me, you're a dead man.

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: And that's when he left. I never saw any of them again.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Aren't you nervous telling me all this after receiving all those death threats?

speaker: BLAINE FAULKNER
line: Well, I didn't, I didn't spend all those years playing Dungeons and Dragons and not learn a little something about courage.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Oh. Mm-hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: After not recovering the tape, Mulder was heading back to the motel and that's when his account of things gets a little... odd.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lieutenant Jack Schaffer?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: This is not happening! It's not happening! This is not happening. It's not happening. It's not happening. Used to project the image of the Virgin Mary over the French trenches in World War One. The enemy's always willing to fire upon an invading force... but on a holy miracle?

speaker: MULDER
line: Or on visitors from outer space?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Yeah, the enemy sees an American recon plane, they start shooting. They see a flying saucer from another galaxy... they hesitate. You know what happens to most people after seeing a UFO?

speaker: MULDER
line: They experience "missing time."

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Any number of "soft option kills" will do... nerve gas... low frequency infrasound beams... Hell, with high-powered microwaves, you can not only cut enemy communications, you can cook internal organs.

speaker: MULDER
line: But abductions?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Don't know as much about them. I'm just the pilot. You ever flown a flying saucer? Afterwards, sex seems trite.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what do you do with the abductees?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Take them back to the base. Let the doctors work on them. Nothing physical, they just mess with their minds.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hypnosis.

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: At the base, I've seen people go into an ordinary room with an ordinary bunch of doctors... and come out absolutely positive they were probed by aliens.

speaker: MULDER
line: But if abductions are just a covert intelligence operation and UFOs are merely secret military airships, piloted by aliens such as yourself... then what were you abducted by?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Don't you get it? I'm absolutely positive me, my copilot, and those two kids were abducted but I can't be absolutely sure it happened. I can't be sure of anything anymore!

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: I'm not sure we're even having this conversation. I don't know if these mashed potatoes are really here. I don't know if you even exist.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can only assure you that I do.

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Well... thanks, buddy. Unfortunately... I can't give you the same assurance about me. Well, looks like I'm a dead man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait a minute, wait a minute. It can't all be fake memory implantations. What about that third alien? What, what was that thing?

speaker: JACK SCHAFFER
line: Who? Lord Kinbote?

speaker: SOLDIER
line: Right, come on.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: That is odd. Because almost every day I was there, I ate lunch at that diner and became dear friends with the cook. He told me a story about the night you're talking about. A man walked into his place...

speaker: MULDER
line: Sweet potato pie.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Sat down, ordered sweet potato pie, identified himself as F.B.I. Agent Mulder. He then questioned my friend.

speaker: MULDER
line: You ever seen a UFO in these parts?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: He then ordered piece after piece, each time asking another question.

speaker: MULDER
line: You ever experienced a period of "missing time?" You ever had the suspicion that you've been abducted by aliens? Have you ever found a metal implant in your body? Have you checked everywhere?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: He ate a whole pie in that fashion, then got up and left. My friend never saw him again. The cook never mentioned Lieutenant Schaffer, let alone any other Air Force personnel. You seem non-nonplused by these contradictions?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, not after what happened when Mulder left the diner and got back to the motel.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? Where's Scully?

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: Oh. She, uh... she went to get some ice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is she?! Scully, what's going on here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, these gentlemen have something very important to tell you.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: Some alien encounters are hoaxes perpetrated by your government to manipulate the public. Some of these hoaxes are intentionally revealed to manipulate the truth-seekers who become discredited if they disclose the deliberately absurd deception.

speaker: MULDER
line: Similar things are said about the men in black. That they purposely dress and behave strangely so that if anyone tries to describe an encounter with them, they come off sounding like a lunatic.

speaker: 1ST MAN IN BLACK
line: I find absolutely no reason why anyone would think you crazy if you described this meeting of ours.

speaker: 2ND MAN IN BLACK
line: You're feeling very sleepy, very... relaxed.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Alex Trebek? The game show host?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder didn't say that it was Alex Trebek. It was just someone that looked incredibly like him.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Did he? I mean, you were there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, not exactly, I'm... I don't have any recollection of this. I... was surprised to wake up the next morning with Mulder asleep in my room. But, Mulder... I, I don't even remember letting you in.

speaker: MULDER
line: I told you, you didn't let me in. They were already here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully. We'll be right there. That was Detective Manners. He said they just found your bleeping UFO.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Apparently, that was the cause of all those UFO sightings three nights ago. They refused our assistance because it's some kind of top secret, experimental plane.

speaker: MULDER
line: They don't want assistance. They want witnesses to their alibi.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Excuse me, ma'am.

speaker: MANNERS
line: Hey! That was the guy that was... Bleep.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know it probably doesn't have the sense of closure that you want... but it has more than some of our other cases.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: What can I do for you, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't write this book. You'll perform a disservice through a field of inquiry that has always struggled for respectability. You're a gifted writer, but no amount of talent could describe the events that occurred in any realistic vein because they deal with alternative realities that we've yet to comprehend. And when presented in the wrong way, in the wrong context, the incidents and the people involved in them can appear foolish, if not downright psychotic. I also know that your publishing house is owned by Warden White, Incorporated... a subsidiary of MacDougall-Kesler, which makes me suspect a covert agenda for your book on the part of the military-industrial-entertainment complex.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Agent Mulder, this book will be written. But it can only benefit if you can explain something to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's that?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: What really happened to those kids on that night?

speaker: MULDER
line: How the hell should I know?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Agent Mulder, I appreciate this little visit but I have deadlines to face. Evidence of extraterrestrial existence remains as elusive as ever......but the skies will continue to be searched by the likes of Blaine Faulkner, hoping to someday find not only proof of alien life, but also contentment on a new world. Until then, he must be content with his new job. Others search for answers from within. Roky relocated to El Cajon, California, preaching to the lost and desperate.

speaker: ROKY CRIKENSON
line: And so, at each death, the soul descends further into the inner earth, attaining ever greater levels of purification, reaching... enlightenment at the core. Assuming, of course, that your soul is able to avoid... the lava men.

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Seeking the truth about aliens means a perfunctory nine-to-five job to some. For although Agent Diana Lesky is noble spirit and pure of heart, she remains, nevertheless, a federal employee. As for her partner, Reynard Muldrake... that ticking timebomb of insanity... his quest into the unknown has so warped his psyche, one shudders to think how he receives pleasures from life. Chrissy Giorgio has come to believe her alien visitation was a message to improve her own world, and she has devoted herself to this goal wholeheartedly.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Oh, it's you. What do you want?

speaker: HAROLD LAMB
line: I just wanted to tell you I still love you.

speaker: CHRISSY GIORGIO
line: Love. Is that all you men think about?

speaker: JOSE CHUNG
line: Then there are those who care not about extraterrestrials, searching for meaning in other human beings. Rare or lucky are those who find it. For although we may not be alone in the universe, in our own separate ways on this planet, we are all... alone.
